item.title: Litter including broken bottles, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Entire street a complete mess again, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish piling up in shared alleyway/garage area that is causing access issues and debris causing punctures to vehicles., 1st July
item.description:
The rubbish has now been there for around 2 months and is continuing to grow waiting for the owners of the rubbish following work to their homes (11/11A St Paul’s Road, Erith, DA8) to remove it. It is an obstruction and is causing debris which is damaging vehicles and encouraging others to dump their rubbish in the alley. The workers told us the owner would be removing the rubbish but it is still there. It is impacting all those who use the area for parking and accessing their properties.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Paul's Road, Northumberland Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Issues persists: abandoned and unroadworthy cars dumped and taking up parking spaces - Fermoy Rd, 1st July
item.description:
Issues persists: abandoned and unroadworthy cars dumped and taking up parking spaces - Fermoy Rd. Cars look dumped and makes road feel unkempt and unsafe. Cars are rusty, damaged and dangerous for children who may get harmed if walking past and touching it. Howcome the council have allowed this to happen? It’s not just 1 or 2 cars but most days it’s many dumped and damaged cars
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Fermoy Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Requesting tree planting, 1st July
item.description:
We would like the council to consider planting of trees along the wider footpath where 79, 82 Fermoy Road are. These are new build blocks and no provision was made to plant trees to soften the look or add to greener space. All other roads in nearby area are tree-lined, except this piece of Fermoy Road. This corner seems a bit neglected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Fermoy Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree base growth needs sorting, 1st July
item.description:
Many trees along Fermoy Road and Hormead Road have basal / base growth which makes walking past harder, and less appealing to look at. Can they be cut back?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Fermoy Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping by bus stop again, 1st July
item.description:
A constant issue of flytipping at the bus stop next to Midfield Way, Croxley Green bus stop. Do not know if vehicles near the waste were connected. Reports continuing though residents have asked for more action then just clean up, as it encourages pests in the area. Need cameras, with more surveillance and stricter controls in area. This is getting out of control. Please do something more!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Midfield Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
